item.title: F@#$ You Inwi
item.description: I was happy that I could switch from a 12 Mbps ADSL connection to a 20 Mbps fiber optics. It was refreshing, although the speed wasn’t particularly impressive. still, for the same price I would definitely make the switch. At the time, Inwi was the only provider offering fiber optics in my area, so I switched like any sane person did. After a few months of use, problems began to appear. People told me that Inwi is a good company, but I didn’t realize I was simply talking to folks who use fiber optics for entertainment only. They aren’t tech‑savvy; all they know is that the internet is Google, cloud storage is in the air, and ChatGPT is a miracle.

item.title: Three Years at University Wasted?
item.description:
Before making any bad assumptions, let me clarify that I’m not dismissing the importance of attending college. It’s still a valuable investment in one’s education and can provide a competitive edge in the job market. However, I’d like to share my personal experience as a recent graduate.

Is university a waste of time? The answer depends on various factors. In my case, attending a public university was an okay experience, which I’d rate as 5 out of 10 for several reasons.
